statement.tex: \\ %text Given that \[ 5x-2 = A\cdot(6x+2) + B \], which of the following sets of statements is true? %
\\ %text As for \[B =\frac{11}{3}\int\frac{dx}{1+2x+3x^2}dx \], which of the \underline{\text{following sets of statements is true}}? %

reason.tex:
%text Recall that \[ 6x+2 = \frac{d}{dx}(1+2x+3x^2) \]
% \begin{align} \therefore z = 1+2x+3x^2 &\implies dz = (6x+2)\cdot dx \\ \therefore A = \frac{5}{6}\int\frac{6x + 2}{1+2x+3x^2}dx &= \frac{5}{6}\int\frac{dz}{z} \\ &= \frac{5}{6}\log\left\vert z\right\vert + C_1 \\ &= \frac{5}{6}\left\vert1+2x+3x^2\right\vert + C_1 \end{align}

\begin{align} 1+2x + 3x^2 &= 3\left(x^2 + \frac{2}{3}x + \frac{1}{3}\right) \\ &= 3\left[\underbrace{\left(x+\frac{1}{3}\right)^2}_{ = x^2 + \frac{2}{3}x + \frac{1}{9}} - \frac{1}{9} + \frac{1}{3}\right] \\ &= 3\left[\left(x+\frac{1}{3}\right)^2 + \left(\frac{\sqrt{2}}{3}\right)^2\right] \\ \therefore B &= \frac{11}{3}\int\frac{dx}{1+2x+3x^2} \\ &= \frac{11}{9}\int\frac{dx}{\left(x+\frac{1}{3}\right)^2 + \left(\frac{\sqrt{2}}{3}\right)^2} \\ &= \frac{11}{9}\cdot\underbrace{\frac{1}{\frac{\sqrt{2}}{3}}\tan^{-1}\left(\frac{x+\frac{1}{3}}{\frac{\sqrt{2}}{3}}\right)}_{\int\frac{dx}{x^2+a^2} = \frac{1}{a}\tan^{-1}\frac{x}{a}} \\ &= \frac{11}{3\sqrt{2}}\tan^{-1}\left(\frac{3x+1}{\sqrt{2}}\right) + C_2 \end{align} \\ %text
That is it! \[ I =\int\frac{5x-2}{1+2x+3x^2}dx = A -B \] from Steps 2 and 3. %
